required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Observational Study on Efficacy and Safety of Norditropin® in Children With Prader-Willi Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Norditropin® (Somatropin) in Children With Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Europe. The aim of this observational study is to collect data from children with Prader-Willi Syndrome, who have been treated off-label with Norditropin® for more than 12 months to seek approval for Norditropin® treatment with Prader-Willi Syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary objective is to investigate changes in height Standard Deviation Score (SDS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: in response to 12 months Norditropin® treatment in children with PWS (referenced to PWS population

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in height SDS from start of treatment to last observation during Norditropin treatment (referenced to PWS population1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition (DEXA, Bio impedance or stable isotope dilution)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Height velocity (HV) and change in HV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment
at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment
at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment
at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) and active form of free thyroxin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment
at 12 months- and at last observation during Norditropin treatment

intervention.description: Prader-Willi syndrome children treated with at least one dose of Norditropin®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent obtained before any trial-related activities
- Genetically diagnosed Prader-Willi Syndrome
- Received at least one dose of Norditropin® treatment
- Pre-pubertal at start of treatment; assessed by Tanner stage 1, or testicular volume below 4ml (according to Tanner 1976)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-treatment with other Growth Hormone preparation prior to treatment with Norditropin®
